decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Unnumbered location plan, Planning Fire Safety Strategy received 06/05/2024 B218102-02 � 3000 Rev B, B218102-02 � 3100 Rev B, Design & Access Statement, Planning Fire Safety Strategy
Received 09/10/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - The window(s) to be fitted on the [front/rear] roof face of the dwelling shall be black-framed and traditional, conservation-style.
Reason: In order to safeguard the architectural and historic interest of the [conservation area/listed building].

Condition : 5 - The western side elevation (right side) hereby approved shall be implemented on site as approved and rear roof slope shall be visible and separate from the hereby approved rear dormer.
Reason: In the interest of the visual amenity of the area.
description: Erection of a rear roof extension with Juliet balcony and two front roof windows with raising of ridge height
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
